title: Supplemental Information 6: Sequence alignment at the AP2/ERF domain across multiple ERFVII amino acid compositions using MegaX software.
Supplementary file 2. Cas12a multiple sequence alignment.
subtitle: Multiple sequence alignment of Cas12a proteins as described in Materials and methods.

data.abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>Alignment of structural RNAs is an important problem with a wide range of applications. Since function is often determined by molecular structure, RNA alignment programs should take into account both sequence and base-pairing information for structural homology identification. A number of successful alignment programs are heuristic versions of Sankoff’s optimal algorithm. Most of them require <jats:italic>O</jats:italic>(<jats:italic>n</jats:italic><jats:sup>4</jats:sup>) run time. This paper describes <jats:monospace>C++</jats:monospace> software, <jats:monospace>RNAmountAlign</jats:monospace>, for RNA sequence/structure alignment that runs in <jats:italic>O</jats:italic>(<jats:italic>n</jats:italic><jats:sup>3</jats:sup>) time and <jats:italic>O</jats:italic>(<jats:italic>n</jats:italic><jats:sup>2</jats:sup>) space; moreover, our software returns a <jats:italic>p</jats:italic>-value (transformable to expect value <jats:italic>E</jats:italic>) based on Karlin-Altschul statistics for local alignment, as well as parameter fitting for local and global alignment. Using incremental mountain height, a representation of structural information computable in cubic time, <jats:monospace>RNAmountAlign</jats:monospace> implements quadratic time pairwise local, global and global/semiglobal (query search) alignment using a weighted combination of sequence and structural similarity. <jats:monospace>RNAmountAlign</jats:monospace> is capable of performing progressive multiple alignment as well. Benchmarking of <jats:monospace>RNAmountAlign</jats:monospace> against <jats:monospace>LocARNA, LARA, FOLDALIGN, DYNALIGN</jats:monospace> and <jats:monospace>STRAL</jats:monospace> shows that <jats:monospace>RNAmountAlign</jats:monospace> has reasonably good accuracy and much faster run time supporting all alignment types.</jats:p><jats:sec><jats:title>Availability</jats:title><jats:p><jats:monospace>RNAmountAlign</jats:monospace> is publicly available at <jats:ext-link xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" ext-link-type="uri" xlink:href="http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/RNAmountAlign">http://bioinformatics.bc.edu/clotelab/RNAmountAlign</jats:ext-link>.</jats:p></jats:sec>
title: RNAmountAlign: efficient software for local, global, semiglobal pairwise and multiple RNA sequence/structure alignment
